clinical_study.official_title: Online Assessment for Therapy Expectation and Quality of Life and Online Therapy of Depression

brief_summary.textblock:
One Aim of the current study is to better understand why some patients suffering from depression do not seek professional help by doctors but in the internet.
Furthermore patients with depression will receive Online Therapy for depression. Aim of this part of the study is to investigate whether quality of life changes accordingly to improvement of symptoms after online therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
- German speaking patients can register online. There will be no side visits.
- After screening: patients which meet inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria can take part in online therapy for depression.
- After 12 weeks 2nd online survey. After this survey patients can use the program the following 6 months (follow-up)
- After 6 months 3rd and last online-survey.
- According to the aims of the study cross-sectional as well as longitudinal data will be obtained and analysed

primary_outcome.time_frame: at screening, post treatment (3 months) and follow-up (6 months after post)
primary_outcome.description: WHOQol brev - WHO quality of life questionnaire short form

secondary_outcome.time_frame: screening, post treatment (3 months), follow-up(6 months after post)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire PSQI - Pittsburgh sleep quality index
patients receive mail support or not during follow up. Questionnaire: BDI - Beck Depression Inventory

other_outcome.measure: change of therapy expectation during online-therapy
other_outcome.description: therapy expectation at screening and after intervention. Questionnaire: PECHI - Psychotherapy Expectations, Concerns, and Hopes Inventory
influences on outcome? Questionnaire: TAS - Toronto Alexithymia Scale

other_outcome.measure: satisfaction with current and former therapies and influence on decision for online therapy
other_outcome.description: adapted version of ZUF-8 (= "Zufriedenheitsfragebogen mit der Behandlung" english version CSQ- client satisfaction questionnaire) for different experiences with therapy (e.g. for depression, for other psychiatric illnesses)
influencing outcome? measured with SOC-13 -Sense of Coherence Scale

other_outcome.time_frame: + 3 months after screening (post) and + 6 months after post
other_outcome.description: measured with SOC-13 does online-therapy helps to develop a better SOC?

other_outcome.time_frame: + 3 months after screening (post) , + 6 months after post
other_outcome.description: Trait and state characteristics of alexithymia in depression measured with TAS-20

intervention.description: between post treatment and follow up two groups: one with unspecific mail support every 2 weeks one without

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- German language
- depression at least slight according BDI (Beck depression inventory) and at least 2 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe depression according BDI
- suicidal ideation
- alcohol or drug dependency
- history of psychotic symptoms
- history of bipolar disorder or previous mania
- current in-patient care or semi-residential treatment
